moe.nea.molecula

Interface Widget

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Layout
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Button, ColumnLayout, ScreenLayout

    public interface Widget
    A widget is something that can be rendered in a MoleculaGui. Each widget is responsible for requesting a certain amount of display space and should only draw within that display space. During render(moe.nea.molecula.RenderPass)ing each widget can assume that it has exactly the space that it returned from the last occupy(moe.nea.molecula.SizeConstraint) call. The next highest Layout is responsible for positioning, so each widget (including Layouts) can assume that the top left of the allotted space is at 0, 0.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      SizeConstraint occupy(SizeConstraint available)
      Occupy is called by Molecula every time a relayout is requested (for example: in case of a screen size update).
      void render(RenderPass renderPass)
      Render in accordance with the specified render pass.

    • Method Detail

      • occupy

        SizeConstraint occupy(SizeConstraint available)
        Occupy is called by Molecula every time a relayout is requested (for example: in case of a screen size update).
        Parameters:
        available - the maximum space available for this widget
        Returns:
        the minimum size that this layout needs

      • render

        void render(RenderPass renderPass)
        Render in accordance with the specified render pass. To do this use RenderPass.renderInPhase(moe.nea.molecula.RenderPass.Key, java.util.function.Consumer<moe.nea.molecula.RenderContext>) along with RenderPass.Key. Do not do conditional logic outside the RenderPass.renderInPhase(moe.nea.molecula.RenderPass.Key, java.util.function.Consumer<moe.nea.molecula.RenderContext>) callback, as that might influence the RenderPass calculator and prevent part of your GUI from being rendered at all.
